duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide professional nursing care to patients applying specialized knowledge and skills from biological, physical, and behavioral sciences.
Implement the five phases of the nursing process and professional standards of care for patient treatment, counsel, and education.
Problem-solve and exercise critical thinking skills to assign and direct others in the delivery of patient care.
Demonstrate exceptional customer service skills and knowledge about the care of neonatal, pediatric, adolescent, adult, and geriatric patients.
Apply basic computer knowledge for patient recordkeeping and management.

education_certification.credential: Associates Degree in Nursing (ADN), Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) program within 3 years of hire, and completion within 5 years of hire.
Current Michigan Nursing license and Current BLS certification or obtained during Patient Care Orientation.
